summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview report of Steve Scully, a former telecommunications technician for Jeffrey Epstein on his private island from approximately 1999-2006. Scully describes Epstein's operations, staff, and observations of underage girls and suspicious activities on the island, including parties and interactions with Epstein and his associates.

persons.name: Steve Scully
persons.role: Former telecommunications technician for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI, worked for Epstein on his private island from approx. 1999-2005/2006, installed phone and internet systems, observed activities and staff on the island.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as 'a pretty bad guy' and 'an intense man' by Scully. Owned the private island and other homes, was concerned with telecommunications, hosted 'special parties' with young teenaged girls.

persons.name: Miles Alexander
persons.context: One of two property managers on Epstein's island. Epstein would not let both managers leave the island at the same time.

persons.name: Cathy Alexander
persons.context: One of two property managers on Epstein's island. Hated Epstein and was disgusted by pictures of young girls in his bedroom.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Described in a topless picture with two other young girls (believed 15-16) on the island. An engineer named Bosco said she was 'like Epstein's daughter' and did special projects for him.

persons.name: Bosco
persons.context: An engineer often on the island who told Scully not to ask about Sarah Kellen if he liked working there.

persons.name: Alan
persons.context: One of Epstein's attorneys who stayed on the island on one occasion, described by Scully as a 'dick'.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Was always on speed dial on all of Epstein's phones, according to Scully.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Met by Scully on the island, described as a 'gutsy and manipulative woman' who shared an office with Epstein.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Observed by Scully on the island with a bodyguard, recalled 'grinding against some young girl in the pool'.

connections.description: Scully worked as a telecommunications technician for Epstein on his private island from approximately 1999-2005/2006.
Miles Alexander worked as a property manager on Epstein's island. Epstein imposed a rule that he and Cathy Alexander could not both leave the island at the same time.
Cathy Alexander worked as a property manager on Epstein's island and hated him, particularly disgusted by pictures of young girls in his bedroom.
Bosco described Kellen as 'like Epstein's daughter' who did special projects for him. A topless picture of her with other young girls was seen in Epstein's office.
Maxwell shared an office with Epstein on the island and is described as a gutsy and manipulative woman.
Wexner was always on speed dial on all of Epstein's phones, indicating a close or frequently contacted relationship.
Alan is identified as one of Epstein's attorneys who stayed on the island on one occasion.
Prince Andrew was observed visiting Epstein's island, and Scully recalled him grinding against a young girl in the pool.
Bosco warned Scully not to ask about Sarah Kellen if he wanted to keep working there, indicating he had knowledge of her role.

events.title: Scully's Employment on Epstein's Island
events.description: Steve Scully worked as a telecommunications technician for Jeffrey Epstein on his private island, visiting approximately 100 times during this period.

events.title: FBI Interview of Steve Scully
events.description: Steve Scully was interviewed by the FBI at the St. Thomas Resident Agency in the Virgin Islands regarding his work for Jeffrey Epstein and observations on the private island.

events.title: Epstein Requires Bodyguards to Carry Guns
events.description: After 2001, Epstein required all his personal bodyguards to carry guns, some on ankle holsters.

events.title: Observation of Prince Andrew with Young Girl
events.description: Scully recalled observing Prince Andrew on the island, grinding against a young girl in the pool.

events.title: Observation of Naked Girls in Grotto
events.description: Scully recalled seeing three young girls and a man in the 'grotto' area of the island; the girls were naked and did not look 18.

events.title: Scully Quits After Conversation with Pool Guy
events.description: Scully quit his job the day after a pool guy (brought from West Palm Beach) told him 'what's with the young girls' and 'I turned a blind eye', adding it was worse in West Palm Beach.

locations: Epstein's private island (location in the Virgin Islands)
Florida (Epstein home, West Palm Beach mentioned)
South Africa (possible relocation destination for the Alexanders)
keyFacts: Steve Scully, a former telecom technician for Epstein, observed pictures of young girls in Epstein's bedroom and a topless photo of Sarah Kellen with two other girls believed to be 15-16 years old.

Scully described 'special parties' on the island which meant there would be young teenaged girls present, and he observed naked underage girls in the grotto and a boat trip with Epstein and two 14-year-old girls.
Prince Andrew was observed on the island by Scully, who recalled him 'grinding against some young girl in the pool'.
Epstein had a rule that his two property managers, Miles and Cathy Alexander, could not both leave the island at the same time, and Cathy Alexander hated Epstein.
Les Wexner was always on speed dial on all of Epstein's phones, indicating a close and frequently contacted relationship.
